trans-unit.source: All Azure technical articles contain two metadata sections - a properties section and a tags section.
trans-unit.target: All Azure technical articles contain two metadata sections - a properties section and a tags section.

trans-unit.source: The properties section enables some website automation and SEO stuff, while the tags section enables a lot of internal content reporting.
trans-unit.target: The properties section enables some website automation and SEO stuff, while the tags section enables a lot of internal content reporting.

trans-unit.source: [Attributes and values for the properties section]
trans-unit.target: [Attributes and values for the properties section]

trans-unit.source: [Attributes and values for the tags section]
trans-unit.target: [Attributes and values for the tags section]

trans-unit.source: The properties section uses the following syntax:
trans-unit.target: The properties section uses the following syntax:

trans-unit.source: The tags section uses the following syntax:
trans-unit.target: The tags section uses the following syntax:

trans-unit.source: The element name and attribute names are case sensitive.
trans-unit.target: The element name and attribute names are case sensitive.

trans-unit.source: section must be the first line of your file.
trans-unit.target: section must be the first line of your file.

trans-unit.source: Leave a blank line after each metadata section and before your page title to ensure that the page title is correctly converted to HTML during the publishing process.
trans-unit.target: Leave a blank line after each metadata section and before your page title to ensure that the page title is correctly converted to HTML during the publishing process.

trans-unit.source: Attributes and values for the properties section
trans-unit.target: Attributes and values for the properties section

trans-unit.source: The text for this attribute appears in the browser tab and as the title in a search result.
trans-unit.target: The text for this attribute appears in the browser tab and as the title in a search result.

trans-unit.source: Use 55-60 characters including spaces and including the site identifier *| Microsoft Azure* (typed as: space pipe space Microsoft Azure).
trans-unit.target: Use 55-60 characters including spaces and including the site identifier *| Microsoft Azure* (typed as: space pipe space Microsoft Azure).

trans-unit.source: The pageTitle should be different from the H1.
trans-unit.target: The pageTitle should be different from the H1.

trans-unit.source: ![](./media/article-metadata/checkmark-small.png)**description**: Required; important for SEO (relevance) and site functionalities.
trans-unit.target: ![](./media/article-metadata/checkmark-small.png)**description**: Required; important for SEO (relevance) and site functionalities.

trans-unit.source: The description should be at least 125 characters long to 155 characters maximum including spaces.
trans-unit.target: The description should be at least 125 characters long to 155 characters maximum including spaces.

trans-unit.source: Describe the purpose of your content so customers will know whether to choose it from a list of search results.
trans-unit.target: Describe the purpose of your content so customers will know whether to choose it from a list of search results.

trans-unit.source: Usually displayed as the description or abstract paragraph in search results
trans-unit.target: Usually displayed as the description or abstract paragraph in search results

trans-unit.source: Will soon be displayed automatically on documentation landing pages as the description that appears when you click "More".
trans-unit.target: Will soon be displayed automatically on documentation landing pages as the description that appears when you click "More".

trans-unit.source: It may appear in other contexts on azure.microsoft.com.
trans-unit.target: It may appear in other contexts on azure.microsoft.com.

trans-unit.source: ![](./media/article-metadata/checkmark-small.png)**services**: Required for articles that deal with a service.
trans-unit.target: ![](./media/article-metadata/checkmark-small.png)**services**: Required for articles that deal with a service.

trans-unit.source: List all the applicable services, separated by commas.
trans-unit.target: List all the applicable services, separated by commas.

trans-unit.source: The first service that you list will drive the navigational breadcrumbs for the page.
trans-unit.target: The first service that you list will drive the navigational breadcrumbs for the page.

trans-unit.source: In articles that specify both a services value and a documentationCenter value, the services value will drive the breadcrumb.
trans-unit.target: In articles that specify both a services value and a documentationCenter value, the services value will drive the breadcrumb.

trans-unit.source: ![](./media/article-metadata/checkmark-small.png)**documentationCenter**: Required for dev-centric articles best featured through a dev center.
trans-unit.target: ![](./media/article-metadata/checkmark-small.png)**documentationCenter**: Required for dev-centric articles best featured through a dev center.

trans-unit.source: Specify the single dev center or language that applies to the article.
trans-unit.target: Specify the single dev center or language that applies to the article.

trans-unit.source: The value you list will drive the navigational breadcrumbs for the page.
trans-unit.target: The value you list will drive the navigational breadcrumbs for the page.

trans-unit.source: In articles that specify both a services value and a documentationCenter value, the services value will drive the breadcrumb.
trans-unit.target: In articles that specify both a services value and a documentationCenter value, the services value will drive the breadcrumb.

trans-unit.source: List the GitHub account for the primary author or article SME.
trans-unit.target: List the GitHub account for the primary author or article SME.

trans-unit.source: This attribute drives the byline on the published article.
trans-unit.target: This attribute drives the byline on the published article.

trans-unit.source: List only one, in spite of the plural name of the attribute.
trans-unit.target: List only one, in spite of the plural name of the attribute.

trans-unit.source: ![](./media/article-metadata/checkmark-small.png)**manager**: Required if you are a Microsoft contributor.
trans-unit.target: ![](./media/article-metadata/checkmark-small.png)**manager**: Required if you are a Microsoft contributor.

trans-unit.source: List the alias of the content publishing manager for the technology area.
trans-unit.target: List the alias of the content publishing manager for the technology area.

trans-unit.source: If you are a community contributor, include the attribute but leave it empty so we can fill it out.
trans-unit.target: If you are a community contributor, include the attribute but leave it empty so we can fill it out.

trans-unit.source: Do not use it for other purposes.
trans-unit.target: Do not use it for other purposes.

trans-unit.source: Include only if you want to enable a link under the article breadcrumb to the article index page (http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/) to a prefiltered list of articles that match one of the approved values.
trans-unit.target: Include only if you want to enable a link under the article breadcrumb to the article index page (http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/) to a prefiltered list of articles that match one of the approved values.

trans-unit.source: These values are meant to provide a way to group content together when the content grouping is not service-specific.
trans-unit.target: These values are meant to provide a way to group content together when the content grouping is not service-specific.

trans-unit.source: These tags can also provide labeling that indicates the technology stack the article applies to.
trans-unit.target: These tags can also provide labeling that indicates the technology stack the article applies to.

trans-unit.source: This value **does not** support free-form tags or hashtags; the tags must be enabled on the site.
trans-unit.target: This value **does not** support free-form tags or hashtags; the tags must be enabled on the site.

trans-unit.source: You can supply multiple tags values to one article, separated by commas.
trans-unit.target: You can supply multiple tags values to one article, separated by commas.

trans-unit.source: Attributes and values for the tags section
trans-unit.target: Attributes and values for the tags section

trans-unit.source: Specifies the Azure service, tool, or feature that the article applies to.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the Azure service, tool, or feature that the article applies to.

trans-unit.source: If a page applies to multiple services, choose the service to which it most directly applies; for instance, an article that uses an app hosted on web sites to demonstrate Service Bus functionality should have the **service-bus** value, rather than **web-sites**.
trans-unit.target: If a page applies to multiple services, choose the service to which it most directly applies; for instance, an article that uses an app hosted on web sites to demonstrate Service Bus functionality should have the **service-bus** value, rather than **web-sites**.

trans-unit.source: If a page applies to multiple services equally, choose **multiple**.
trans-unit.target: If a page applies to multiple services equally, choose **multiple**.

trans-unit.source: If a page does not apply to any services (this will be rare), choose **NA**.
trans-unit.target: If a page does not apply to any services (this will be rare), choose **NA**.

trans-unit.source: **app-service**: Only applies to general conceptual material on App Service
trans-unit.target: **app-service**: Only applies to general conceptual material on App Service

trans-unit.source: **multiple**: The page applies to multiple services equally
trans-unit.target: **multiple**: The page applies to multiple services equally

trans-unit.source: **na**: The page does not apply to any services (rare)
trans-unit.target: **na**: The page does not apply to any services (rare)

trans-unit.source: **store**: Articles about services available through the Azure Store
trans-unit.target: **store**: Articles about services available through the Azure Store

trans-unit.source: Specifies the programming language that the article applies to.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the programming language that the article applies to.

trans-unit.source: If a page applies to two programming languages equally, choose **multiple**.
trans-unit.target: If a page applies to two programming languages equally, choose **multiple**.

trans-unit.source: If a page is primarily conceptual and its content is generally applicable to multiple programming languages, choose **multiple**.
trans-unit.target: If a page is primarily conceptual and its content is generally applicable to multiple programming languages, choose **multiple**.

trans-unit.source: If a page is not targeted at developers and the programming language applicability is not relevant, choose **NA**.
trans-unit.target: If a page is not targeted at developers and the programming language applicability is not relevant, choose **NA**.

trans-unit.source: Use **rest-api** to identify REST API reference topics.
trans-unit.target: Use **rest-api** to identify REST API reference topics.

trans-unit.source: **multiple**: The page applies to multiple programming languages equally.
trans-unit.target: **multiple**: The page applies to multiple programming languages equally.

trans-unit.source: **na**: The page is not targeting developers and is not specific to any programming languages.
trans-unit.target: **na**: The page is not targeting developers and is not specific to any programming languages.

trans-unit.source: Most new pages created by contributors will be article or reference.
trans-unit.target: Most new pages created by contributors will be article or reference.

trans-unit.source: **article**: A conceptual topic, tutorial, feature guide, or other non-reference article
trans-unit.target: **article**: A conceptual topic, tutorial, feature guide, or other non-reference article

trans-unit.source: A page that is specifically designed as a landing page for external campaigns, and is not included as part of the primary site IA.
trans-unit.target: A page that is specifically designed as a landing page for external campaigns, and is not included as part of the primary site IA.

trans-unit.source: Should not be used for documentation articles or regular doc landing pages.
trans-unit.target: Should not be used for documentation articles or regular doc landing pages.

trans-unit.source: A dev center home page, e.g. /develop/net/
trans-unit.target: A dev center home page, e.g. /develop/net/

trans-unit.source: **get-started-article**: assign to articles that are featured in the Get Started section of the left navigation for a service.
trans-unit.target: **get-started-article**: assign to articles that are featured in the Get Started section of the left navigation for a service.

trans-unit.source: **hero-article**: a "hero" tutorial that is designed to provide an introduction to a service or feature that gets visitors started using the service quickly and drives free-trial sign-ups and MSDN activations.
trans-unit.target: **hero-article**: a "hero" tutorial that is designed to provide an introduction to a service or feature that gets visitors started using the service quickly and drives free-trial sign-ups and MSDN activations.

trans-unit.source: Assign this value ONLY to articles that are featured at the top of the documentation landing page for your service.
trans-unit.target: Assign this value ONLY to articles that are featured at the top of the documentation landing page for your service.

trans-unit.source: We only have two: azure.microsoft.com/documentation/ and msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/
trans-unit.target: We only have two: azure.microsoft.com/documentation/ and msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/

trans-unit.source: **index-page**: Second-level landing pages for programming languages, services, or features.
trans-unit.target: **index-page**: Second-level landing pages for programming languages, services, or features.

trans-unit.source: These are spread across Azure.com and the library, and are used as entry points for more specific, scoped information.
trans-unit.target: These are spread across Azure.com and the library, and are used as entry points for more specific, scoped information.

trans-unit.source: A page that features a browsable infographic or poster, for instance http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/infographics/windows-azure/
trans-unit.target: A page that features a browsable infographic or poster, for instance http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/infographics/windows-azure/

trans-unit.source: **reference**: An API reference page (including REST API) or PowerShell cmdlet reference page
trans-unit.target: **reference**: An API reference page (including REST API) or PowerShell cmdlet reference page

trans-unit.source: A doc service home page, e.g. /documentation/services/virtual-machines/
trans-unit.target: A doc service home page, e.g. /documentation/services/virtual-machines/

trans-unit.source: A "home page" for a particular type of content on azure.com Examples: http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/infographics/, http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/scripts/, http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/videos/home/, http://azure.microsoft.com/downloads/
trans-unit.target: A "home page" for a particular type of content on azure.com Examples: http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/infographics/, http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/scripts/, http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/videos/home/, http://azure.microsoft.com/downloads/

trans-unit.source: A page that features a video, for instance http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/videos/azure-webjobs-hosting-testing-net/
trans-unit.target: A page that features a video, for instance http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/videos/azure-webjobs-hosting-testing-net/

trans-unit.source: Specifies the target platform, for instance Windows, Linux, Windows Phone, iOS, Android, or special cache platforms.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the target platform, for instance Windows, Linux, Windows Phone, iOS, Android, or special cache platforms.

trans-unit.source: This value will be **NA** for most topics except mobile and virtual machines.
trans-unit.target: This value will be **NA** for most topics except mobile and virtual machines.

trans-unit.source: **ibiza**: content that uses the Ibiza portal.
trans-unit.target: **ibiza**: content that uses the Ibiza portal.

trans-unit.source: Use this only in cases where the feature being discussed is available across both the Ibiza portal and the current portal.
trans-unit.target: Use this only in cases where the feature being discussed is available across both the Ibiza portal and the current portal.

trans-unit.source: **mobile-windows**: Azure.com only right now; Windows Universal
trans-unit.target: **mobile-windows**: Azure.com only right now; Windows Universal

trans-unit.source: **mobile-xamarin**: Azure.com only right now; Xamarin all platforms
trans-unit.target: **mobile-xamarin**: Azure.com only right now; Xamarin all platforms

trans-unit.source: **multiple**: The page applies to multiple platforms equally
trans-unit.target: **multiple**: The page applies to multiple platforms equally

trans-unit.source: **na**: A platform specifier is not applicable for this page
trans-unit.target: **na**: A platform specifier is not applicable for this page

trans-unit.source: **vs-getting-started**: Identifies the VS Getting Started page group.
trans-unit.target: **vs-getting-started**: Identifies the VS Getting Started page group.

trans-unit.source: **vs-what-happened**: Identifies the VS Getting Started What Happened page.
trans-unit.target: **vs-what-happened**: Identifies the VS Getting Started What Happened page.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the Azure workload that the page applies to.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the Azure workload that the page applies to.

trans-unit.source: **update 8/6/15** The ms.workload value is being mapped by an xls, not the value in the .md file.
trans-unit.target: **update 8/6/15** The ms.workload value is being mapped by an xls, not the value in the .md file.

trans-unit.source: The ms.workload value is still required for validation until the feature can be updated.
trans-unit.target: The ms.workload value is still required for validation until the feature can be updated.

trans-unit.source: That work is now being scheduled.
trans-unit.target: That work is now being scheduled.

trans-unit.source: Please use **"na"** as the value for now.
trans-unit.target: Please use **"na"** as the value for now.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the date the article was last reviewed for relevance, accuracy, correct screen shots, and working links.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the date the article was last reviewed for relevance, accuracy, correct screen shots, and working links.

trans-unit.source: Enter the date in mm/dd/yyyy format.
trans-unit.target: Enter the date in mm/dd/yyyy format.

trans-unit.source: This date also appears on the published article as the last updated date.
trans-unit.target: This date also appears on the published article as the last updated date.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the author(s) associated with the topic.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the author(s) associated with the topic.

trans-unit.source: To specify multiple values you should separate them with semicolons.
trans-unit.target: To specify multiple values you should separate them with semicolons.

trans-unit.source: Either Microsoft aliases or complete email addresses are acceptable.
trans-unit.target: Either Microsoft aliases or complete email addresses are acceptable.

trans-unit.source: The length can be no longer than 200 characters.
trans-unit.target: The length can be no longer than 200 characters.
